intro: Hieracium praecox subsp. petiolare, commonly known as the early hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and often hairy. The plant produces yellow composite flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are usually petiolated, giving it its subspecific name, and it thrives in moist, disturbed soils. It is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges.
